00016 void
00017 SgAsmGenericFile::ctor()
00018 {
00019     ROSE_ASSERT(this != NULL);
00020 
00021     ROSE_ASSERT(p_fd == -1);
00022     ROSE_ASSERT(p_holes == NULL);
00023     ROSE_ASSERT(p_truncate_zeros == false);
00024 
00025     ROSE_ASSERT(p_headers == NULL);
00026     p_headers  = new SgAsmGenericHeaderList();
00027     ROSE_ASSERT(p_headers != NULL);
00028     p_headers->set_parent(this);
00029 
00030     ROSE_ASSERT(p_holes == NULL);
00031     p_holes  = new SgAsmGenericSectionList();
00032     ROSE_ASSERT(p_holes != NULL);
00033     p_holes->set_parent(this);
00034 }
00035 
00037 SgAsmGenericFile *
00038 SgAsmGenericFile::parse(std::string fileName)
00039 {
00040     ROSE_ASSERT(p_fd < 0); /*can call parse() only once per object*/
00041 
00042     set_name(fileName);
00043     p_fd = open(fileName.c_str(), O_RDONLY);
00044     if (p_fd<0 || fstat(p_fd, &p_sb)<0) {
00045         std::string mesg = "Could not open binary file";
00046         throw FormatError(mesg + ": " + strerror(errno));
00047     }
00048     size_t nbytes = p_sb.st_size;
00049 
00050     /* To be more portable across operating systems, read the file into memory rather than mapping it. */
00051     unsigned char *mapped = new unsigned char[nbytes];
00052     if (!mapped)
00053         throw FormatError("Could not allocate memory for binary file");
00054     ssize_t nread = read(p_fd, mapped, nbytes);
00055     if (nread<0 || (size_t)nread!=nbytes)
00056     {
00057       delete [] mapped;
00058       throw FormatError("Could not read entire binary file");
00059     }
00060 
00061     /* Decode the memory if necessary */
00062     DataConverter *dc = get_data_converter();
00063     if (dc) {
00064         unsigned char *new_mapped = dc->decode(mapped, &nbytes);
00065         if (new_mapped!=mapped) {
00066             delete[] mapped;
00067             mapped = new_mapped;
00068         }
00069     }
00070     
00071     /* Make file contents available through an STL vector without actually reading the file */
00072     p_data = SgFileContentList(mapped, nbytes);
00073     return this;
00074 }
00075 
00076 /* Destructs by closing and unmapping the file and destroying all sections, headers, etc. */
00077 SgAsmGenericFile::~SgAsmGenericFile() 
00078 {
00079     /* AST child nodes have already been deleted if we're called from SageInterface::deleteAST() */
00080 
00081     /* Unmap and close */
00082     unsigned char *mapped = p_data.pool();
00083     if (mapped && p_data.size()>0)
00084         delete[] mapped;
00085     p_data.clear();
00086 
00087     if ( p_fd >= 0 )
00088         close(p_fd);
00089 }

00099 rose_addr_t
00100 SgAsmGenericFile::get_current_size() const
00101 {
00102     rose_addr_t retval=0;
00103     SgAsmGenericSectionPtrList sections = get_sections();
00104     for (SgAsmGenericSectionPtrList::iterator i=sections.begin(); i!=sections.end(); ++i) {
00105         retval = std::max(retval, (*i)->get_end_offset());
00106     }
00107     return retval;
00108 }

00111 void
00112 SgAsmGenericFile::mark_referenced_extent(rose_addr_t offset, rose_addr_t size)
00113 {
00114     if (get_tracking_references()) {
00115         p_referenced_extents.insert(Extent(offset, size));
00116         delete p_unreferenced_cache;
00117         p_unreferenced_cache = NULL;
00118     }
00119 }
00120 
00122 const ExtentMap &
00123 SgAsmGenericFile::get_unreferenced_extents() const
00124 {
00125     if (!p_unreferenced_cache) {
00126         p_unreferenced_cache = new ExtentMap();
00127         *p_unreferenced_cache = p_referenced_extents.subtract_from(Extent(0, get_current_size()));
00128     }
00129     return *p_unreferenced_cache;
00130 }
00131 
00137 size_t
00138 SgAsmGenericFile::read_content(rose_addr_t offset, void *dst_buf, rose_addr_t size, bool strict)
00139 {
00140     size_t retval;
00141     if (offset+size <= p_data.size()) {
00142         retval = size;
00143     } else if (offset > p_data.size()) {
00144         if (strict)
00145             throw ShortRead(NULL, offset, size);
00146         retval = 0;
00147     } else {
00148         if (strict)
00149             throw ShortRead(NULL, p_data.size(), offset+size - (p_data.size()+offset));
00150         retval = p_data.size() - offset;
00151     }
00152     if (retval>0)
00153         memcpy(dst_buf, &(p_data[offset]), retval);
00154     if (get_tracking_references())
00155         mark_referenced_extent(offset, retval);
00156     memset((char*)dst_buf+retval, 0, size-retval);
00157     return retval;
00158 }
00159 
00164 size_t
00165 SgAsmGenericFile::read_content(const MemoryMap *map, rose_addr_t start_va, void *dst_buf, rose_addr_t size, bool strict)
00166 {
00167     ROSE_ASSERT(map!=NULL);
00168 
00169     /* Note: This is the same algorithm as used by MemoryMap::read() except we do it here so that we have an opportunity
00170      *       to track the file byte references. */
00171     size_t ncopied = 0;
00172     while (ncopied < size) {
00173         rose_addr_t va = start_va + ncopied;
00174         size_t nread = map->read1((uint8_t*)dst_buf+ncopied, va, size-ncopied, MemoryMap::MM_PROT_NONE);
00175         if (0==nread) break;
00176 
00177         if (get_tracking_references()) {
00178             assert(map->exists(va));
00179             std::pair<Extent, MemoryMap::Segment> me = map->at(va);
00180             if (me.second.get_buffer()->get_data_ptr()==&(get_data()[0])) {
00181                 /* We are tracking file reads and this segment does, indeed, point into the file. */
00182                 size_t file_offset = me.second.get_buffer_offset(me.first, va);
00183                 mark_referenced_extent(file_offset, nread);
00184             }
00185         }
00186 
00187         ncopied += nread;
00188     }
00189 
00190     if (ncopied<size) {
00191         if (strict)
00192             throw MemoryMap::NotMapped("SgAsmGenericFile::read_content() no mapping", map, start_va+ncopied);
00193         memset((char*)dst_buf+ncopied, 0, size-ncopied);                /*zero pad result if necessary*/
00194     }
00195     return ncopied;
00196 }
00197 
00203 std::string
00204 SgAsmGenericFile::read_content_str(const MemoryMap *map, rose_addr_t va, bool strict)
00205 {
00206     static char *buf=NULL;
00207     static size_t nalloc=0;
00208     size_t nused=0;
00209 
00210     /* Note: reading one byte at a time might not be the most efficient way to do this, but it does cause the referenced bytes
00211      *       to be tracked very precisely. */ 
00212     while (1) {
00213         if (nused >= nalloc) {
00214             nalloc = std::max((size_t)32, 2*nalloc);
00215             buf = (char*)realloc(buf, nalloc);
00216             ROSE_ASSERT(buf!=NULL);
00217         }
00218 
00219         unsigned char byte;
00220         read_content(map, va+nused, &byte, 1, strict); /*might throw RvaSizeMap::NotMapped or return a NUL*/
00221         if (!byte)
00222             return std::string(buf, nused);
00223         buf[nused++] = byte;
00224     }
00225 }

00236     static size_t nalloc=0;
00237     size_t nused=0;
00238 
00239     /* Note: reading one byte at a time might not be the most efficient way to do this, but it does cause the referenced bytes
00240      *       to be tracked very precisely. */ 
00241     while (1) {
00242         if (nused >= nalloc) {
00243             nalloc = std::max((size_t)32, 2*nalloc);
00244             buf = (char*)realloc(buf, nalloc);
00245             ROSE_ASSERT(buf!=NULL);
00246         }
00247 
00248         unsigned char byte;
00249         read_content(offset+nused, &byte, 1, strict); /*might throw ShortRead or return a NUL*/
00250         if (!byte)
00251             return std::string(buf, nused);
00252         buf[nused++] = byte;
00253     }
00254 }

00271 void
00272 SgAsmGenericFile::add_header(SgAsmGenericHeader *header) 
00273 {
00274     ROSE_ASSERT(p_headers!=NULL);
00275     p_headers->set_isModified(true);
00276 
00277 #ifndef NDEBUG
00278     /* New header must not already be present. */
00279     for (size_t i=0; i< p_headers->get_headers().size(); i++) {
00280         ROSE_ASSERT(p_headers->get_headers()[i] != header);
00281     }
00282 #endif
00283     header->set_parent(p_headers);
00284     p_headers->get_headers().push_back(header);
00285 }
00286 
00288 void
00289 SgAsmGenericFile::remove_header(SgAsmGenericHeader *hdr)
00290 {
00291     if (hdr!=NULL) {
00292         ROSE_ASSERT(p_headers  != NULL);
00293         SgAsmGenericHeaderPtrList::iterator i = find(p_headers->get_headers().begin(), p_headers->get_headers().end(), hdr);
00294         if (i != p_headers->get_headers().end()) {
00295             p_headers->get_headers().erase(i);
00296             p_headers->set_isModified(true);
00297         }
00298     }
00299 }

00331 
00333 SgAsmGenericSectionPtrList
00334 SgAsmGenericFile::get_sections(bool include_holes) const
00335 {
00336     SgAsmGenericSectionPtrList retval;
00337 
00338     /* Start with headers and holes */
00339     retval.insert(retval.end(), p_headers->get_headers().begin(), p_headers->get_headers().end());
00340     if (include_holes)
00341         retval.insert(retval.end(), p_holes->get_sections().begin(), p_holes->get_sections().end());
00342 
00343     /* Add sections pointed to by headers. */
00344     for (SgAsmGenericHeaderPtrList::iterator i=p_headers->get_headers().begin(); i!=p_headers->get_headers().end(); ++i) {
00345         if ((*i)->get_sections()!=NULL) {
00346             const SgAsmGenericSectionPtrList &recurse = (*i)->get_sections()->get_sections();
00347             retval.insert(retval.end(), recurse.begin(), recurse.end());
00348         }
00349     }
00350     return retval;
00351 }

00354 SgAsmGenericSectionPtrList
00355 SgAsmGenericFile::get_mapped_sections() const
00356 {
00357     SgAsmGenericSectionPtrList retval;
00358     SgAsmGenericSectionPtrList all = get_sections(true);
00359     for (size_t i=0; i<all.size(); i++) {
00360         if (all[i]->is_mapped())
00361             retval.push_back(all[i]);
00362     }
00363     return retval;
00364 }

00367 SgAsmGenericSectionPtrList
00368 SgAsmGenericFile::get_sections_by_id(int id) const
00369 {
00370     SgAsmGenericSectionPtrList retval;
00371 
00372     /* Holes */
00373     for (SgAsmGenericSectionPtrList::iterator i=p_holes->get_sections().begin(); i!=p_holes->get_sections().end(); ++i) {
00374         if ((*i)->get_id()==id)
00375             retval.push_back(*i);
00376     }
00377 
00378     /* Headers and their sections */
00379     for (SgAsmGenericHeaderPtrList::iterator i=p_headers->get_headers().begin(); i!=p_headers->get_headers().end(); ++i) {
00380         if ((*i)->get_id()==id)
00381             retval.push_back(*i);
00382         const SgAsmGenericSectionPtrList &recurse = (*i)->get_sections_by_id(id);
00383         retval.insert(retval.end(), recurse.begin(), recurse.end());
00384     }
00385     return retval;
00386 }

00390 SgAsmGenericSection *
00391 SgAsmGenericFile::get_section_by_id(int id, size_t *nfound/*optional*/) const
00392 {
00393     SgAsmGenericSectionPtrList possible = get_sections_by_id(id);
00394     if (nfound) *nfound = possible.size();
00395     return possible.size()==1 ? possible[0] : NULL;

00399 SgAsmGenericSectionPtrList
00400 SgAsmGenericFile::get_sections_by_name(std::string name, char sep/*or NUL*/) const
00401 {
00402     SgAsmGenericSectionPtrList retval;
00403 
00404     /* Truncate name */
00405     if (sep) {
00406         size_t pos = name.find(sep);
00407         if (pos!=name.npos)
00408             name.erase(pos);
00409     }
00410 
00411     /* Holes */
00412     for (SgAsmGenericSectionPtrList::iterator i=p_holes->get_sections().begin(); i!=p_holes->get_sections().end(); ++i) {
00413         std::string secname = (*i)->get_name()->get_string();
00414         if (sep) {
00415             size_t pos = secname.find(sep);
00416             if (pos!=secname.npos)
00417                 secname.erase(pos);
00418         }
00419         if (0==secname.compare(name))
00420             retval.push_back(*i);
00421     }
00422 
00423     /* Headers and their sections */
00424     for (SgAsmGenericHeaderPtrList::iterator i=p_headers->get_headers().begin(); i!=p_headers->get_headers().end(); ++i) {
00425         std::string secname = (*i)->get_name()->get_string();
00426         if (sep) {
00427             size_t pos = secname.find(sep);
00428             if (pos!=secname.npos)
00429                 secname.erase(pos);
00430         }
00431         if (0==secname.compare(name))
00432             retval.push_back(*i);
00433 
00434         const SgAsmGenericSectionPtrList &recurse = (*i)->get_sections_by_name(name, sep);
00435         retval.insert(retval.end(), recurse.begin(), recurse.end());
00436     }
00437     return retval;
00438 }

00445 {

00450 
00452 SgAsmGenericSectionPtrList
00453 SgAsmGenericFile::get_sections_by_offset(rose_addr_t offset, rose_addr_t size) const
00454 {
00455     SgAsmGenericSectionPtrList retval;
00456 
00457     /* Holes */
00458     for (SgAsmGenericSectionPtrList::iterator i=p_holes->get_sections().begin(); i!=p_holes->get_sections().end(); ++i) {
00459         if (offset >= (*i)->get_offset() &&
00460             offset < (*i)->get_offset()+(*i)->get_size() &&
00461             offset-(*i)->get_offset() + size <= (*i)->get_size())
00462             retval.push_back(*i);
00463     }
00464 
00465     /* Headers and their sections */
00466     for (SgAsmGenericHeaderPtrList::iterator i=p_headers->get_headers().begin(); i!=p_headers->get_headers().end(); ++i) {
00467         if (offset >= (*i)->get_offset() &&
00468             offset < (*i)->get_offset()+(*i)->get_size() &&
00469             offset-(*i)->get_offset() + size <= (*i)->get_size())
00470             retval.push_back(*i);
00471         const SgAsmGenericSectionPtrList &recurse = (*i)->get_sections_by_offset(offset, size);
00472         retval.insert(retval.end(), recurse.begin(), recurse.end());
00473     }
00474     return retval;
00475 }

00489 SgAsmGenericSectionPtrList
00490 SgAsmGenericFile::get_sections_by_rva(rose_addr_t rva) const
00491 {
00492     SgAsmGenericSectionPtrList retval;
00493 
00494     /* Holes (probably not mapped anyway) */
00495     for (SgAsmGenericSectionPtrList::iterator i=p_holes->get_sections().begin(); i!=p_holes->get_sections().end(); ++i) {
00496         if ((*i)->is_mapped() &&
00497             rva >= (*i)->get_mapped_preferred_rva() && rva < (*i)->get_mapped_preferred_rva() + (*i)->get_mapped_size())
00498             retval.push_back(*i);
00499     }
00500 
00501     /* Headers and their sections */
00502     for (SgAsmGenericHeaderPtrList::iterator i=p_headers->get_headers().begin(); i!=p_headers->get_headers().end(); ++i) {
00503         if ((*i)->is_mapped() &&
00504             rva >= (*i)->get_mapped_preferred_rva() && rva < (*i)->get_mapped_preferred_rva() + (*i)->get_mapped_size())
00505             retval.push_back(*i);
00506         const SgAsmGenericSectionPtrList &recurse = (*i)->get_sections_by_rva(rva);
00507         retval.insert(retval.end(), recurse.begin(), recurse.end());
00508     }
00509     return retval;
00510 }

00514 SgAsmGenericSection *

00521 
00524 SgAsmGenericSectionPtrList
00525 SgAsmGenericFile::get_sections_by_va(rose_addr_t va) const
00526 {
00527     SgAsmGenericSectionPtrList retval;
00528 
00529     /* Holes (probably not mapped anyway) */
00530     for (SgAsmGenericSectionPtrList::iterator i=p_holes->get_sections().begin(); i!=p_holes->get_sections().end(); ++i) {
00531         rose_addr_t rva = va; /* Holes don't belong to any header and therefore have a zero base_va */
00532         if ((*i)->is_mapped() &&
00533             rva >= (*i)->get_mapped_preferred_rva() && rva < (*i)->get_mapped_preferred_rva() + (*i)->get_mapped_size())
00534             retval.push_back(*i);
00535     }
00536 
00537     /* Headers and their sections */
00538     for (SgAsmGenericHeaderPtrList::iterator i=p_headers->get_headers().begin(); i!=p_headers->get_headers().end(); ++i) {
00539         /* Headers probably aren't mapped, but just in case... */
00540         rose_addr_t rva = va; /* Headers don't belong to any header and therefore have a zero base_va */
00541         if ((*i)->is_mapped() &&
00542             rva >= (*i)->get_mapped_preferred_rva() && rva < (*i)->get_mapped_preferred_rva() + (*i)->get_mapped_size())
00543             retval.push_back(*i);
00544 
00545         /* Header sections */
00546         const SgAsmGenericSectionPtrList &recurse = (*i)->get_sections_by_va(va, true);
00547         retval.insert(retval.end(), recurse.begin(), recurse.end());
00548     }
00549     return retval;
00550 }

00561 
00565 SgAsmGenericSection *
00566 SgAsmGenericFile::get_best_section_by_va(rose_addr_t va, size_t *nfound/*optional*/) const
00567 {
00568     const SgAsmGenericSectionPtrList &candidates = get_sections_by_va(va);
00569     if (nfound)
00570         *nfound = candidates.size();
00571     return best_section_by_va(candidates, va);
00572 }
00573 
00582 SgAsmGenericSection *
00583 SgAsmGenericFile::best_section_by_va(const SgAsmGenericSectionPtrList &sections, rose_addr_t va)
00584 {
00585     SgAsmGenericSection *best = NULL;
00586     rose_addr_t file_offset = 0;
00587     for (SgAsmGenericSectionPtrList::const_iterator si=sections.begin(); si!=sections.end(); ++si) {
00588         SgAsmGenericSection *section = *si;
00589         if (!section->is_mapped() || va<section->get_mapped_actual_va() ||
00590             va>=section->get_mapped_actual_va()+section->get_mapped_size()) {
00591             // section does not contain virtual address
00592         } else if (!best) {
00593             best = section;
00594             file_offset = section->get_offset() + (va - section->get_mapped_actual_va());
00595         } else if (file_offset != section->get_offset() + (va - section->get_mapped_actual_va())) {
00596             return NULL; // error
00597         } else if (best->get_mapped_size() > section->get_mapped_size()) {
00598             best = section;
00599         } else if (best->get_name()->get_string().empty() && !section->get_name()->get_string().empty()) {
00600             best = section;
00601         } else {
00602             // prefer section defined earlier
00603         }
00604     }
00605     return best;
00606 }
00607 
00610 SgAsmGenericSection *
00611 SgAsmGenericFile::get_best_possible_section_by_va(rose_addr_t va)
00612 {
00613   // This function is implemented for use in:
00614   //      "DisassemblerCommon::AsmFileWithData::getSectionOfAddress(uint64_t addr)"
00615   // It supports a more restrictive selection of valid sections to associate with 
00616   // a given address so that we can avoid disassembly of sections that are not code.
00617 
00618      const std::vector<SgAsmGenericSection*> &possible = get_sections_by_va(va);
00619 
00620      if (0 == possible.size())
00621         {
00622           return NULL;
00623         }
00624        else
00625         {
00626           if (1 == possible.size())
00627              {
00628             // printf ("Only one alternative: va = %p possible[0] id = %d name = %s (return %s) \n",
00629             //      (void*)va,possible[0]->get_id(),possible[0]->get_name().c_str(),(possible[0]->get_id() < 0) ? "NULL" : "it");
00630             // return possible[0];
00631                if (possible[0]->get_id() < 0)
00632                     return NULL;
00633                  else
00634                     return possible[0];
00635              }
00636         }
00637 
00638 #if 0
00639      printf ("Select from %zu alternatives \n",possible.size());
00640      for (size_t i = 0; i < possible.size(); i++)
00641         {
00642           printf ("   va = %p possible[%zu] id = %d name = %s \n",(void*)va,i,possible[i]->get_id(),possible[i]->get_name().c_str());
00643         }
00644 #endif
00645 
00646   /* Choose the "best" section to return. */
00647      SgAsmGenericSection *best = possible[0];
00648      rose_addr_t fo0 = possible[0]->get_va_offset(va);
00649      for (size_t i = 1; i < possible.size(); i++)
00650         {
00651           if (fo0 != possible[i]->get_va_offset(va))
00652             return NULL; /* all possible sections must map the VA to the same file offset */
00653 
00654           if (best->get_id() < 0 && possible[i]->get_id() > 0)
00655              {
00656                best = possible[i]; /*prefer sections defined in a section or object table*/
00657              }
00658             else
00659                if (best->get_mapped_size() > possible[i]->get_mapped_size())
00660                   {
00661                     best = possible[i]; /*prefer sections with a smaller mapped size*/
00662                   }
00663                  else
00664                      if (best->get_name()->get_string().size()==0 && possible[i]->get_name()->get_string().size()>0)
00665                        {
00666                          best = possible[i]; /*prefer sections having a name*/
00667                        }
00668                       else
00669                        {
00670                       /* prefer section defined earlier*/
00671 
00672                        }
00673         }
00674 
00675      ROSE_ASSERT(best != NULL);
00676 
00677   // Add a few things that we just don't want to disassemble
00678      if (best->get_name()->get_string() == "ELF Segment Table")
00679           return NULL;
00680 
00681   // printf ("   best: va = %p id = %d name = %s \n",(void*)va,best->get_id(),best->get_name().c_str());
00682 
00683      return best;
00684 }
00685 
00688 rose_addr_t
00689 SgAsmGenericFile::get_next_section_offset(rose_addr_t offset)
00690 {
00691     rose_addr_t found = ~(rose_addr_t)0;
00692     const SgAsmGenericSectionPtrList &sections = get_sections();
00693     for (SgAsmGenericSectionPtrList::const_iterator i=sections.begin(); i!=sections.end(); ++i) {
00694         if ((*i)->get_offset() >= offset && (*i)->get_offset() < found)
00695             found = (*i)->get_offset();
00696     }
00697     return found;
00698 }
00699 
00736 void
00737 SgAsmGenericFile::shift_extend(SgAsmGenericSection *s, rose_addr_t sa, rose_addr_t sn, AddressSpace space, Elasticity elasticity)
00738 {
00739     ROSE_ASSERT(s!=NULL);
00740     ROSE_ASSERT(s->get_file()==this);
00741     ROSE_ASSERT((space & (ADDRSP_FILE|ADDRSP_MEMORY)) != 0);
00742 
00743     const bool debug = false;
00744     static size_t ncalls=0;
00745     char p[256];
00746 
00747     if (debug) {
00748         const char *space_s="unknown";
00749         if (space & ADDRSP_FILE) {
00750             space_s = "file";
00751         } else if (space & ADDRSP_MEMORY) {
00752             space_s = "memory";
00753         }
00754         sprintf(p, "SgAsmGenericFile::shift_extend[%zu]: ", ncalls++);
00755         fprintf(stderr, "%s    -- START --\n", p);
00756         fprintf(stderr, "%s    S = [%d] \"%s\"\n", p, s->get_id(), s->get_name()->get_string(true).c_str());
00757         fprintf(stderr, "%s    %s Sa=0x%08"PRIx64" (%"PRIu64"), Sn=0x%08"PRIx64" (%"PRIu64")\n", p, space_s, sa, sa, sn, sn);
00758         fprintf(stderr, "%s    elasticity = %s\n", p, (ELASTIC_NONE==elasticity ? "none" :
00759                                                        ELASTIC_UNREF==elasticity ? "unref" :
00760                                                        ELASTIC_HOLE==elasticity ? "unref+holes" :
00761                                                        "unknown"));
00762     }
00763 
00764     /* No-op case */
00765     if (0==sa && 0==sn) {
00766         if (debug) {
00767             fprintf(stderr, "%s    No change necessary.\n", p);
00768             fprintf(stderr, "%s    -- END --\n", p);
00769         }
00770         return;
00771     }
00772     
00773     bool filespace = (space & ADDRSP_FILE)!=0;
00774     bool memspace = (space & ADDRSP_MEMORY)!=0;
00775     rose_addr_t align=1, aligned_sa, aligned_sasn;
00776     SgAsmGenericSectionPtrList neighbors, villagers;
00777     ExtentMap amap; /* address mappings for all extents */
00778     Extent sp;
00779 
00780     /* Get a list of all sections that may need to be adjusted. */
00781     SgAsmGenericSectionPtrList all;
00782     switch (elasticity) {
00783       case ELASTIC_NONE:
00784       case ELASTIC_UNREF:
00785         all = filespace ? get_sections() : get_mapped_sections();
00786         break;
00787       case ELASTIC_HOLE:
00788         all = filespace ? get_sections(false) : get_mapped_sections();
00789         break;
00790     }
00791     if (debug) {
00792         fprintf(stderr, "%s    Following sections are in 'all' set:\n", p);
00793         for (size_t i=0; i<all.size(); i++) {
00794             Extent ep;
00795             if (filespace) {
00796                 ep = all[i]->get_file_extent();
00797             } else {
00798                 ROSE_ASSERT(all[i]->is_mapped());
00799                 ep = all[i]->get_mapped_preferred_extent();
00800             }
00801             fprintf(stderr, "%s        0x%08"PRIx64" 0x%08"PRIx64" 0x%08"PRIx64" [%d] \"%s\"\n",
00802                     p, ep.relaxed_first(), ep.size(), ep.relaxed_first()+ep.size(), all[i]->get_id(),
00803                     all[i]->get_name()->get_string(true).c_str());
00804         }
00805     }
00806 
00807     for (size_t pass=0; pass<2; pass++) {
00808         if (debug) {
00809             fprintf(stderr, "%s    -- %s --\n",
00810                     p, 0==pass?"FIRST PASS":"SECOND PASS (after making a larger hole)");
00811         }
00812 
00813         /* S offset and size in file or memory address space */
00814         if (filespace) {
00815             sp = s->get_file_extent();
00816         } else if (!memspace || !s->is_mapped()) {
00817             return; /*nothing to do*/
00818         } else {
00819             sp = s->get_mapped_preferred_extent();
00820         }
00821     
00822         /* Build address map */
00823         for (size_t i=0; i<all.size(); i++) {
00824             if (filespace) {
00825                 amap.insert(all[i]->get_file_extent());
00826             } else {
00827                 ROSE_ASSERT(all[i]->is_mapped());
00828                 amap.insert(all[i]->get_mapped_preferred_extent());
00829             }
00830         }
00831         if (debug) {
00832             fprintf(stderr, "%s    Address map:\n", p);
00833             amap.dump_extents(stderr, (std::string(p)+"        ").c_str(), "amap");
00834             fprintf(stderr, "%s    Extent of S:\n", p);
00835             fprintf(stderr, "%s        start=0x%08"PRIx64" size=0x%08"PRIx64" end=0x%08"PRIx64"\n",
00836                     p, sp.relaxed_first(), sp.size(), sp.relaxed_first()+sp.size());
00837         }
00838         
00839         /* Neighborhood (nhs) of S is a single extent. However, if S is zero size then nhs might be empty.  The neighborhood of
00840          * S is S plus all sections that overlap with S and all sections that are right-contiguous with S. */
00841         ExtentMap nhs_map;
00842         for (ExtentMap::iterator amapi=amap.begin(); amapi!=amap.end(); ++amapi) {
00843             if (amapi->first.relaxed_first() <= sp.relaxed_first()+sp.size() &&
00844                 amapi->first.relaxed_first()+amapi->first.size() > sp.relaxed_first())
00845                 nhs_map.insert(amapi->first, amapi->second); 
00846         }
00847         if (debug) {
00848             fprintf(stderr, "%s    Neighborhood of S:\n", p);
00849             nhs_map.dump_extents(stderr, (std::string(p)+"        ").c_str(), "nhs_map");
00850         }
00851         Extent nhs;
00852         if (nhs_map.size()>0) {
00853             assert(nhs_map.nranges()==1);
00854             nhs = nhs_map.begin()->first;
00855         } else {
00856             nhs = sp;
00857         }
00858 
00859         /* What sections are in the neighborhood (including S), and right of the neighborhood? */
00860         neighbors.clear(); /*sections in neighborhood*/
00861         neighbors.push_back(s);
00862         villagers.clear(); /*sections right of neighborhood*/
00863         if (debug)
00864             fprintf(stderr, "%s    Ignoring left (L) sections:\n", p);
00865         for (size_t i=0; i<all.size(); i++) {
00866             SgAsmGenericSection *a = all[i];
00867             if (a==s) continue; /*already pushed onto neighbors*/
00868             Extent ap;
00869             if (filespace) {
00870                 ap = a->get_file_extent();
00871             } else if (!a->is_mapped()) {
00872                 continue;
00873             } else {
00874                 ap = a->get_mapped_preferred_extent();
00875             }
00876             switch (ExtentMap::category(ap, nhs)) {
00877               case 'L':
00878                 if (debug)
00879                     fprintf(stderr, "%s        L 0x%08"PRIx64" 0x%08"PRIx64" 0x%08"PRIx64" [%d] \"%s\"\n", 
00880                             p, ap.relaxed_first(), ap.size(), ap.relaxed_first()+ap.size(),
00881                             a->get_id(), a->get_name()->get_string(true).c_str());
00882                 break;
00883               case 'R':
00884                   if (ap.relaxed_first()==nhs.relaxed_first()+nhs.size() && 0==ap.size()) {
00885                     /* Empty sections immediately right of the neighborhood of S should actually be considered part of the
00886                      * neighborhood rather than right of it. */
00887                     neighbors.push_back(a);
00888                 } else if (elasticity!=ELASTIC_NONE) {
00889                     /* If holes are elastic then treat things right of the hole as being part of the right village; otherwise
00890                      * add those sections to the neighborhood of S even though they fall outside 'nhs' (it's OK because this
00891                      * partitioning of sections is the only thing we use 'nhs' for anyway. */
00892                     villagers.push_back(a);
00893                 } else if ('L'==ExtentMap::category(ap, sp)) {
00894                     /*ignore sections left of S*/
00895                 } else {
00896                     neighbors.push_back(a);
00897                 }
00898                 break;
00899               default:
00900                 if ('L'!=ExtentMap::category(ap, sp)) /*ignore sections left of S*/
00901                     neighbors.push_back(a);
00902                 break;
00903             }
00904         }
00905         if (debug) {
00906             fprintf(stderr, "%s    Neighbors:\n", p);
00907             for (size_t i=0; i<neighbors.size(); i++) {
00908                 SgAsmGenericSection *a = neighbors[i];
00909                 Extent ap = filespace ? a->get_file_extent() : a->get_mapped_preferred_extent();
00910                 rose_addr_t align = filespace ? a->get_file_alignment() : a->get_mapped_alignment();
00911                 char cat = ExtentMap::category(ap, sp);
00912                 fprintf(stderr, "%s        %c %c0x%08"PRIx64" 0x%08"PRIx64" 0x%08"PRIx64,
00913                         p, cat, 0==ap.relaxed_first() % (align?align:1) ? ' ' : '!',
00914                         ap.relaxed_first(), ap.size(), ap.relaxed_first()+ap.size());
00915                 if (strchr("RICE", cat)) {
00916                     fprintf(stderr, " align=0x%08"PRIx64, align);
00917                 } else {
00918                     fputs("                 ", stderr);
00919                 }
00920                 fprintf(stderr, " [%2d] \"%s\"\n", a->get_id(), a->get_name()->get_string(true).c_str());
00921             }
00922             if (villagers.size()>0) fprintf(stderr, "%s    Villagers:\n", p);
00923             for (size_t i=0; i<villagers.size(); i++) {
00924                 SgAsmGenericSection *a = villagers[i];
00925                 Extent ap = filespace ? a->get_file_extent() : a->get_mapped_preferred_extent();
00926                 rose_addr_t align = filespace ? a->get_file_alignment() : a->get_mapped_alignment();
00927                 fprintf(stderr, "%s        %c %c0x%08"PRIx64" 0x%08"PRIx64" 0x%08"PRIx64,
00928                         p, ExtentMap::category(ap, sp), /*cat should always be R*/
00929                         0==ap.relaxed_first() % (align?align:1) ? ' ' : '!',
00930                         ap.relaxed_first(), ap.size(), ap.relaxed_first()+ap.size());
00931                 fputs("                 ", stderr);
00932                 fprintf(stderr, " [%2d] \"%s\"\n", a->get_id(), a->get_name()->get_string(true).c_str());
00933             }
00934         }
00935         
00936         /* Adjust Sa to satisfy all alignment constraints in neighborhood(S) for sections that will move (cats R, I, C, and E). */
00937         align = 1;
00938         for (size_t i=0; i<neighbors.size(); i++) {
00939             SgAsmGenericSection *a = neighbors[i];
00940             Extent ap = filespace ? a->get_file_extent() : a->get_mapped_preferred_extent();
00941             if (strchr("RICE", ExtentMap::category(ap, sp))) {
00942                 rose_addr_t x = filespace ? a->get_file_alignment() : a->get_mapped_alignment();
00943                 align = boost::math::lcm(align, x?x:1);
00944             }
00945         }
00946         aligned_sa = (sa/align + (sa%align?1:0))*align;
00947         aligned_sasn = ((sa+sn)/align + ((sa+sn)%align?1:0))*align;
00948         if (debug) {
00949             fprintf(stderr, "%s    Alignment LCM = 0x%08"PRIx64" (%"PRIu64")\n", p, align, align);
00950             fprintf(stderr, "%s    Aligned Sa    = 0x%08"PRIx64" (%"PRIu64")\n", p, aligned_sa, aligned_sa);
00951             fprintf(stderr, "%s    Aligned Sa+Sn = 0x%08"PRIx64" (%"PRIu64")\n", p, aligned_sasn, aligned_sasn);
00952         }
00953         
00954         /* Are there any sections to the right of neighborhood(S)? If so, find the one with the lowest start address and use
00955          * that to define the size of the hole right of neighborhood(S). */
00956         if (0==villagers.size()) break;
00957         SgAsmGenericSection *after_hole = NULL;
00958         Extent hp(0, 0);
00959         for (size_t i=0; i<villagers.size(); i++) {
00960             SgAsmGenericSection *a = villagers[i];
00961             Extent ap = filespace ? a->get_file_extent() : a->get_mapped_preferred_extent();
00962             if (!after_hole || ap.relaxed_first()<hp.relaxed_first()) {
00963                 after_hole = a;
00964                 hp = ap;
00965             }
00966         }
00967         ROSE_ASSERT(after_hole);
00968         ROSE_ASSERT(hp.relaxed_first() > nhs.relaxed_first()+nhs.size());
00969         rose_addr_t hole_size = hp.relaxed_first() - (nhs.relaxed_first()+nhs.size());
00970         if (debug) {
00971             fprintf(stderr, "%s    hole size = 0x%08"PRIx64" (%"PRIu64"); need 0x%08"PRIx64" (%"PRIu64"); %s\n",
00972                     p, hole_size, hole_size, aligned_sasn, aligned_sasn,
00973                     hole_size>=aligned_sasn ? "large enough" : "not large enough");
00974         }
00975         if (hole_size >= aligned_sasn) break;
00976         rose_addr_t need_more = aligned_sasn - hole_size;
00977 
00978         /* Hole is not large enough. We need to recursively move things that are right of our neighborhood, then recompute the
00979          * all-sections address map and neighborhood(S). */
00980         ROSE_ASSERT(0==pass); /*logic problem since the recursive call should have enlarged the hole enough*/
00981         if (debug) {
00982             fprintf(stderr, "%s    Calling recursively to increase hole size by 0x%08"PRIx64" (%"PRIu64") bytes\n",
00983                     p, need_more, need_more);
00984         }
00985         shift_extend(after_hole, need_more, 0, space, elasticity);
00986         if (debug) fprintf(stderr, "%s    Returned from recursive call\n", p);
00987     }
00988 
00989     /* Consider sections that are in the same neighborhood as S */
00990     if (debug) fprintf(stderr, "%s    -- ADJUSTING --\n", p);
00991     bool resized_mem = false;
00992     for (size_t i=0; i<neighbors.size(); i++) {
00993         SgAsmGenericSection *a = neighbors[i];
00994         Extent ap = filespace ? a->get_file_extent() : a->get_mapped_preferred_extent();
00995         switch (ExtentMap::category(ap, sp)) {
00996           case 'L':
00997             break;
00998           case 'R':
00999             if (filespace) {
01000                 a->set_offset(a->get_offset()+aligned_sasn);
01001             } else {
01002                 a->set_mapped_preferred_rva(a->get_mapped_preferred_rva()+aligned_sasn);
01003             }
01004             break;
01005           case 'C': /*including S itself*/
01006           case 'E':
01007             if (filespace) {
01008                 a->set_offset(a->get_offset()+aligned_sa);
01009                 a->set_size(a->get_size()+sn);
01010                 if (memspace && !resized_mem && a->is_mapped()) {
01011                     shift_extend(a, 0, sn, ADDRSP_MEMORY, elasticity);
01012                     resized_mem = true;
01013                 }
01014             } else {
01015                 a->set_mapped_preferred_rva(a->get_mapped_preferred_rva()+aligned_sa);
01016                 a->set_mapped_size(a->get_mapped_size()+sn);
01017             }
01018             break;
01019           case 'O':
01020               if (ap.relaxed_first()==sp.relaxed_first()) {
01021                 if (filespace) {
01022                     a->set_offset(a->get_offset()+aligned_sa);
01023                     a->set_size(a->get_size()+sn);
01024                 } else {
01025                     a->set_mapped_preferred_rva(a->get_mapped_preferred_rva()+aligned_sa);
01026                     a->set_mapped_size(a->get_mapped_size()+sn);
01027                 }
01028             } else {
01029                 if (filespace) {
01030                     a->set_size(a->get_size()+aligned_sasn);
01031                     if (memspace && !resized_mem && a->is_mapped()) {
01032                         shift_extend(a, 0, aligned_sasn, ADDRSP_MEMORY, elasticity);
01033                         resized_mem = true;
01034                     }
01035                 } else {
01036                     a->set_mapped_size(a->get_mapped_size()+aligned_sasn);
01037                 }
01038             }
01039             break;
01040           case 'I':
01041             if (filespace) {
01042                 a->set_offset(a->get_offset()+aligned_sa);
01043             } else {
01044                 a->set_mapped_preferred_rva(a->get_mapped_preferred_rva()+aligned_sa);
01045             }
01046             break;
01047           case 'B':
01048             if (filespace) {
01049                 a->set_size(a->get_size()+sn);
01050                 if (memspace && !resized_mem && a->is_mapped()) {
01051                     shift_extend(a, 0, sn, ADDRSP_MEMORY, elasticity);
01052                     resized_mem = true;
01053                 }
01054             } else {
01055                 a->set_mapped_size(a->get_size()+sn);
01056             }
01057             break;
01058           default:
01059             ROSE_ASSERT(!"invalid extent category");
01060             break;
01061         }
01062         if (debug) {
01063             const char *space_name = filespace ? "file" : "mem";
01064             rose_addr_t x = filespace ? a->get_file_alignment() : a->get_mapped_alignment();
01065             fprintf(stderr, "%s   %4s-%c %c0x%08"PRIx64" 0x%08"PRIx64" 0x%08"PRIx64,
01066                     p, space_name, ExtentMap::category(ap, sp), 
01067                     0==ap.relaxed_first()%(x?x:1)?' ':'!',
01068                     ap.relaxed_first(), ap.size(), ap.relaxed_first()+ap.size());
01069             Extent newap = filespace ? a->get_file_extent() : a->get_mapped_preferred_extent();
01070             fprintf(stderr, " -> %c0x%08"PRIx64" 0x%08"PRIx64" 0x%08"PRIx64,
01071                     0==newap.relaxed_first()%(x?x:1)?' ':'!',
01072                     newap.relaxed_first(), newap.size(), newap.relaxed_first()+newap.size());
01073             fprintf(stderr, " [%2d] \"%s\"\n", a->get_id(), a->get_name()->get_string(true).c_str());
01074         }
01075     }
01076     if (debug) fprintf(stderr, "%s    -- END --\n", p);
01077 }
01078 
01083 void
01084 SgAsmGenericFile::dump_all(bool in_cwd, const char *ext)
01085 {
01086     if (!ext)
01087         ext = ".dump";
01088     std::string dump_name = get_name() + ext;
01089     if (in_cwd) {
01090         size_t slash = dump_name.find_last_of('/');
01091         if (slash!=dump_name.npos)
01092             dump_name.replace(0, slash+1, "");
01093     }
01094     dump_all(dump_name);
01095 }    
01096 
01098 void
01099 SgAsmGenericFile::dump_all(const std::string &dump_name)
01100 {
01101     FILE *dumpFile = fopen(dump_name.c_str(), "wb");
01102     ROSE_ASSERT(dumpFile != NULL);
01103     try {
01104         // The file type should be the first; test harness depends on it
01105         fprintf(dumpFile, "%s\n", format_name());
01106 
01107         // A table describing the sections of the file
01108         dump(dumpFile);
01109 
01110         // Detailed info about each section
01111         const SgAsmGenericSectionPtrList &sections = get_sections();
01112         for (size_t i = 0; i < sections.size(); i++) {
01113             fprintf(dumpFile, "Section [%zd]:\n", i);
01114             ROSE_ASSERT(sections[i] != NULL);
01115             sections[i]->dump(dumpFile, "  ", -1);
01116         }
01117 
01118         /* Dump interpretations that point only to this file. */
01119         SgBinaryComposite *binary = SageInterface::getEnclosingNode<SgBinaryComposite>(this);
01120         ROSE_ASSERT(binary!=NULL);
01121         const SgAsmInterpretationPtrList &interps = binary->get_interpretations()->get_interpretations();
01122         for (size_t i=0; i<interps.size(); i++) {
01123             SgAsmGenericFilePtrList interp_files = interps[i]->get_files();
01124             if (interp_files.size()==1 && interp_files[0]==this) {
01125                 std::string assembly = unparseAsmInterpretation(interps[i]);
01126                 fputs(assembly.c_str(), dumpFile);
01127             }
01128         }
01129         
01130     } catch(...) {
01131         fclose(dumpFile);
01132         throw;
01133     }
01134     fclose(dumpFile);
01135 }
01136 
01137 /* Print basic info about the sections of a file */
01138 void
01139 SgAsmGenericFile::dump(FILE *f) const
01140 {
01141     fprintf(f, "Encoding: %s\n", get_data_converter() ? escapeString(get_data_converter()->name()).c_str() : "none");
01142 
01143     SgAsmGenericSectionPtrList sections = get_sections();
01144     if (sections.size()==0) {
01145         fprintf(f, "No sections defined for file.\n");
01146         return;
01147     }
01148     
01149     /* Sort sections by offset (lowest to highest), then size (largest to smallest but zero-sized entries first) */
01150     for (size_t i = 1; i < sections.size(); i++) {
01151         for (size_t j=0; j<i; j++) {
01152             if (sections[j]->get_offset() == sections[i]->get_offset()) {
01153                 rose_addr_t size_i = sections[i]->get_size();
01154                 if (0==size_i) size_i = ~(rose_addr_t)0;
01155                 rose_addr_t size_j = sections[j]->get_size();
01156                 if (0==size_j) size_j = ~(rose_addr_t)0;
01157                 if (size_j < size_i) {
01158                     SgAsmGenericSection *x = sections[j];
01159                     sections[j] = sections[i];
01160                     sections[i] = x;
01161                 }
01162             } else if (sections[j]->get_offset() > sections[i]->get_offset()) {
01163                 SgAsmGenericSection *x = sections[j];
01164                 sections[j] = sections[i];
01165                 sections[i] = x;
01166             }
01167         }
01168     }
01169     
01170     /* Print results */
01171     fprintf(f, "File sections:\n");
01172     fprintf(f, "  Flg File-Addr  File-Size  File-End    Base-VA    Start-RVA  Virt-Size  End-RVA    Perm  ID Name\n");
01173     fprintf(f, "  --- ---------- ---------- ----------  ---------- ---------- ---------- ---------- ---- --- -----------------\n");
01174     rose_addr_t high_water = 0;
01175     for (size_t i=0; i<sections.size(); i++) {
01176         SgAsmGenericSection *section = sections[i];
01177         
01178         /* Does section overlap with any other (before or after)? */
01179         char overlap[4] = "   "; /* status characters: overlap prior, overlap subsequent, hole */
01180         for (size_t j=0; overlap[0]==' ' && j<i; j++) {
01181             if (sections[j]->get_offset()+sections[j]->get_size() > section->get_offset()) {
01182                 overlap[0] = '<';
01183             }
01184         }
01185         for (size_t j=i+1; overlap[1]==' ' && j<sections.size(); j++) {
01186             if (section->get_offset()+section->get_size() > sections[j]->get_offset()) {
01187                 overlap[1] = '>';
01188             }
01189         }
01190 
01191         /* Is there a hole before section[i]? */
01192         if (high_water < section->get_offset()) {
01193             overlap[2] = 'H'; /* truly unaccounted region of the file */
01194         } else if (i>0 && sections[i-1]->get_offset()+sections[i-1]->get_size() < section->get_offset()) {
01195             overlap[2] = 'h'; /* unaccounted only if overlaps are not allowed */
01196         }
01197         high_water = std::max(high_water, section->get_offset() + section->get_size());
01198         fprintf(f, "  %3s", overlap);
01199 
01200         /* File addresses */
01201         fprintf(f, "%c0x%08"PRIx64" 0x%08"PRIx64" 0x%08"PRIx64,
01202                 section->get_file_alignment()==0 || section->get_offset()%section->get_file_alignment()==0?' ':'!',
01203                 section->get_offset(), section->get_size(), section->get_offset()+section->get_size());
01204 
01205         /* Mapped addresses */
01206         if (section->is_mapped()) {
01207             fprintf(f, " %c0x%08"PRIx64" 0x%08"PRIx64" 0x%08"PRIx64" 0x%08"PRIx64,
01208                     (section->get_mapped_alignment()==0 ||
01209                      section->get_mapped_preferred_rva()%section->get_mapped_alignment()==0?' ':'!'),
01210                     section->get_base_va(), section->get_mapped_preferred_rva(), section->get_mapped_size(),
01211                     section->get_mapped_preferred_rva()+section->get_mapped_size());
01212         } else {
01213             fprintf(f, " %*s", 4*11, "");
01214         }
01215 
01216         /* Permissions */
01217         if (section->is_mapped()) {
01218             fprintf(f, " %c%c%c ",
01219                     section->get_mapped_rperm()?'r':'-',
01220                     section->get_mapped_wperm()?'w':'-', 
01221                     section->get_mapped_xperm()?'x':'-');
01222         } else {
01223             fputs("     ", f);
01224         }
01225 
01226         /* Section ID, name */
01227         if (section->get_id()>=0) {
01228             fprintf(f, " %3d", section->get_id());
01229         } else {
01230             fputs("    ", f);
01231         }
01232         fprintf(f, " %s\n", section->get_name()->get_string(true).c_str());
01233     }
01234 
01235     char overlap[4] = "   ";
01236     if (high_water < get_current_size()) {
01237         overlap[2] = 'H';
01238     } else if (sections.back()->get_offset() + sections.back()->get_size() < get_current_size()) {
01239         overlap[2] = 'h';
01240     }
01241     fprintf(f, "  %3s 0x%08"PRIx64"%*s EOF", overlap, get_current_size(), 76, "");
01242     if (get_current_size()!=p_data.size())
01243         fprintf(f, " (original EOF was 0x%08zx)", p_data.size());
01244     if (get_truncate_zeros())
01245         fputs(" [ztrunc]", f);
01246     fputc('\n', f);
01247     fprintf(f, "  --- ---------- ---------- ----------  ---------- ---------- ---------- ---------- ---- --- -----------------\n");
01248 
01249     /* Show what part of the file has not been referenced */
01250     ExtentMap holes = get_unreferenced_extents();
01251     if (holes.size()>0) {
01252         fprintf(f, "These parts of the file have not been referenced during parsing:\n");
01253         holes.dump_extents(f, "    ", "", false);
01254     }
01255 }
01256 
01260 void
01261 SgAsmGenericFile::fill_holes()
01262 {
01263     /* Get the list of file extents referenced by all file sections */
01264     ExtentMap refs;
01265     SgAsmGenericSectionPtrList sections = get_sections();
01266     for (SgAsmGenericSectionPtrList::iterator i=sections.begin(); i!=sections.end(); ++i) {
01267         refs.insert(Extent((*i)->get_offset(), (*i)->get_size()));
01268     }
01269 
01270     /* The hole extents are everything other than the sections */
01271     ExtentMap holes = refs.subtract_from(Extent(0, p_data.size()));
01272 
01273     /* Create the sections representing the holes */
01274     for (ExtentMap::iterator i=holes.begin(); i!=holes.end(); ++i) {
01275         Extent e = i->first;
01276         SgAsmGenericSection *hole = new SgAsmGenericSection(this, NULL);
01277         hole->set_offset(e.first());
01278         hole->set_size(e.size());
01279         hole->parse();
01280         hole->set_synthesized(true);
01281         hole->set_name(new SgAsmBasicString("hole"));
01282         hole->set_purpose(SgAsmGenericSection::SP_UNSPECIFIED);
01283         add_hole(hole);
01284     }
01285 }
01286 
01288 void
01289 SgAsmGenericFile::unfill_holes()
01290 {
01291     set_isModified(true);
01292 
01293     SgAsmGenericSectionPtrList to_delete = get_holes()->get_sections();
01294     for (size_t i=0; i<to_delete.size(); i++) {
01295         SgAsmGenericSection *hole = to_delete[i];
01296         SageInterface::deleteAST(hole);
01297     }
01298     
01299     /* Destructor for holes should have removed links to those holes. */
01300     ROSE_ASSERT(get_holes()->get_sections().size()==0);
01301 }
01302 
01304 void
01305 SgAsmGenericFile::reallocate()
01306 {
01307     bool reallocated;
01308     do {
01309         reallocated = false;
01310 
01311         /* holes */
01312         for (SgAsmGenericSectionPtrList::iterator i=p_holes->get_sections().begin(); i!=p_holes->get_sections().end(); ++i) {
01313             if ((*i)->reallocate())
01314                 reallocated = true;
01315         }
01316 
01317         /* file headers (and indirectly, all that they reference) */
01318         for (SgAsmGenericHeaderPtrList::iterator i=p_headers->get_headers().begin(); i!=p_headers->get_headers().end(); ++i) {
01319             if ((*i)->reallocate())
01320                 reallocated = true;
01321         }
01322     } while (reallocated);
01323 }
01324 
01329 void
01330 SgAsmGenericFile::unparse(std::ostream &f) const
01331 {
01332     if (get_neuter()) {
01333         f.seekp(0);
01334         f <<"NOTE: ROSE is refusing to create a binary file for this AST.\n"
01335           <<"      See SgAsmGenericFile::set_neuter() for details.\n";
01336         return;
01337     }
01338 
01339 #if 0
01340     /* This is only for debugging -- fill the file with something other than zero so we have a better chance of making sure
01341      * that all data is written back to the file, including things that are zero. */
01342     rose_addr_t remaining = get_current_size();
01343     unsigned char buf[4096];
01344     memset(buf, 0xaa, sizeof buf);
01345     while (remaining>=sizeof buf) {
01346         f.write((const char*)buf, sizeof buf);
01347         ROSE_ASSERT(f);
01348         remaining -= sizeof buf;
01349     }
01350     f.write((const char*)buf, remaining);
01351     ROSE_ASSERT(f);
01352 #endif
01353 
01354     /* Write unreferenced sections (i.e., "holes") back to disk */
01355     for (SgAsmGenericSectionPtrList::iterator i=p_holes->get_sections().begin(); i!=p_holes->get_sections().end(); ++i)
01356         (*i)->unparse(f);
01357     
01358     /* Write file headers (and indirectly, all that they reference) */
01359     for (SgAsmGenericHeaderPtrList::iterator i=p_headers->get_headers().begin(); i!=p_headers->get_headers().end(); ++i)
01360         (*i)->unparse(f);
01361 
01362     /* Extend the file to the full size. The unparser will not write zero bytes at the end of a file because some files
01363      * actually use the fact that sections that extend past the EOF will be zero padded.  For the time being we'll extend the
01364      * file to its full size. */
01365     if (!get_truncate_zeros())
01366         extend_to_eof(f);
01367 }
01368 
01370 void
01371 SgAsmGenericFile::extend_to_eof(std::ostream &f) const
01372 {
01373     f.seekp(0, std::ios::end);
01374     if (f.tellp()<(off_t)get_current_size()) {
01375         f.seekp(get_current_size()-1);
01376         const char zero = '\0';
01377         f.write(&zero, 1);
01378     }
01379 }
01380 
01381 
01384 const char *
01385 SgAsmGenericFile::format_name() const
01386 {
01387     return p_headers->get_headers().back()->format_name();
01388 }
01389 
01391 SgAsmGenericHeader *
01392 SgAsmGenericFile::get_header(SgAsmGenericFormat::ExecFamily efam)
01393 {
01394     SgAsmGenericHeader *retval = NULL;
01395     for (size_t i = 0; i < p_headers->get_headers().size(); i++) {
01396         if (p_headers->get_headers()[i]->get_exec_format()->get_family() == efam) {
01397             ROSE_ASSERT(NULL == retval);
01398             retval = p_headers->get_headers()[i];
01399         }
01400     }
01401 
01402     return retval;
01403 }
